excerpt: Colorful, Army-maintained Hindu temple complex with dramatic valley & mountain views.
detail_description: Hanuman Tok is a renowned Hindu temple complex in Gangtok, maintained by the Indian Army. Positioned at an elevation of 7200 feet, it provides breathtaking views of the majestic Mt Kanchenjunga peak and the surrounding hills. The temple holds religious significance and is believed to fulfill the wishes of its devotees. Its captivating beauty, lush greenery, and clear blue skies make it a must-visit for both locals and tourists exploring Gangtok.
name: Hanuman Tok
address: 8JXH+4FP, Gangtok, Sikkim 737103, India

excerpt: Quaint Hindu temple with sweeping hilltop views, plus a cafe offering drinks & light bites.
detail_description: Ganesh Tok is a charming Hindu temple located about 7 km from Gangtok, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the sprawling city and the majestic Himalayan landscape. From this elevated ridge, visitors can marvel at the snow-capped peaks of Mt. Khangchendzonga and Mt. Siniolchu, creating an awe-inspiring backdrop to the picturesque city below.
name: Ganesh Tok
address: 8JRC+HGM, Jawaharlal Nehru Rd, Sungava, Gangtok, Sikkim 737103, India

excerpt: Binoculars are recommended at this viewing platform for observing Kanchenjunga & surrounding hills.
detail_description: Tashi View Point, built by the King of Sikkim, Tashi Namgyal, holds historical significance and offers a mesmerizing view of Mt. Kanchenjunga. It is an ideal spot to witness the sunrise and enjoy the panoramic beauty as the sun sets over Kanchenjunga and Siniolchu peaks. The viewpoint is located 8 km from Gangtok and provides a peaceful escape from urban development.
name: Tashi View Point
address: Gangtok, Sikkim 737107, India

excerpt: Large hilltop Buddhist temple with a golden-domed stupa, elaborate shrines & engraved prayer wheels.
detail_description: Do Drul Chorten is a significant Buddhist stupa located in Gangtok, Sikkim. Built in 1945 by Trulshik Rinpoche, it features an impressive golden-domed stupa and around 108 prayer wheels engraved with mantras. The site also houses religious texts and objects. Situated near the Institute of Tibetology, this serene locale offers visitors the chance to explore Buddhist sites and monasteries.
name: Do Drul Chorten
address: 8J73+4WP, M.P.Golai, Tadong, Gangtok, Sikkim 737102, India

excerpt: Secluded, colorful Tibetan Buddhist monastery dating to 1908, standing on a hill above Gangtok.
detail_description: Perched on a hill above Gangtok, Enchey Monastery is a vibrant Tibetan Buddhist site established in 1908. Alongside other revered monasteries like Rumtek, Ranka, Tashiding, Tsuk La Khang, and Pemayangste in the area, it holds great spiritual significance. Visitors seeking soulful experiences are drawn to this serene sanctuary for its breathtaking views of Gangtok and the majestic Kanchenjunga peak.
name: Enchey Monastery
address: 8JP9+9MF, Gangtok, Sikkim 737103, India

excerpt: Museum, library & research venue devoted to Tibetan culture, with statues, scrolls & ritual objects.
detail_description: The Namgyal Institute of Tibetology, established in 1958, is a museum, library, and research venue dedicated to Tibetan culture. Housed in a traditional Tibetan-style building, it boasts one of the largest collections of Tibetan works outside of Tibet.
name: Namgyal Institute of Tibetology
address: 8J83+9WF, Deorali Rd, M.P.Golai, Tadong, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

excerpt: Sprawling zoological park with select animals, a watchtower & views of Mount Khangchendzonga.
detail_description: Nestled in a sprawling 230-hectare forested hill, Sikkim Himalayan Zoological Park is a haven for nature and wildlife enthusiasts. The park is home to various animals including the adorable Red Panda, Bengal tigers, black panthers, Himalayan Black Bears, Clouded Leopards, and more. Visitors can explore the fenced areas on foot or opt for a half-day car tour. Additionally, the park offers stunning views of Mount Khangchendzonga.
name: Sikkim Himalayan Zoological Park
address: Jawaharlal Nehru Rd, Sungava, Gangtok, Sikkim 737103, India

detail_description: The Flower Exhibition Centre - Ridge Park, located in Gangtok, is a paradise for nature lovers. It showcases flora from diverse parts of Sikkim under one roof and is a must-visit destination. The center hosts an annual flower show from April to May, featuring a stunning display of orchids and other flowers from the region.
name: Flower Exhibition Centre - Ridge Park.
address: 8JJ8+MG7, Arithang, Gangtok, Sikkim 737111, India

excerpt: Peaceful Buddhist monastery known for its vibrant, decorative facade & charming hillside locale.
detail_description: Pal Karma Zurmang Shedup Chokhor Ling Lingdum Monastery, also known as Ranka Monastery, is a serene Buddhist monastery located about 20 km from Gangtok in East Sikkim. The monastery features traditional Tibetan architecture and is renowned for its vibrant frescoes, hand paintings, Thankas, and the lively Lama Mask dance performed by the monks during the Losar festival.
name: Pal Karma Zurmang Shedup Chokhor Ling Lingdum Monastery (Ranka Monastery)
address: 8HJH+FJF, Lingdum, Sikkim 737135, India

detail_description: Ban Jhakri Falls Park is a captivating sightseeing destination spread over two acres of land, located about 10-12 kilometers from Gangtok en route to Ranka monastery. The main attraction is the waterfall, which tumbles down from a rocky height of approximately 40 feet with great force. The park features beautifully landscaped gardens adorned with statues depicting the local culture and ancestors.
name: Ban Jhakri Falls Park
address: Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

excerpt: Gangtok is the capital of the mountainous northern Indian state of Sikkim. Established as a Buddhist pilgrimage site in the 1840s, the city became capital of an independent monarchy after British rule ended, but joined India in 1975. Today, it remains a Tibetan Buddhist center and a base for hikers organizing permits and transport for treks through Sikkim’s Himalayan mountain ranges.
detail_description: Gangtok, the capital of Sikkim, is a city with a rich history as a Buddhist pilgrimage site and an independent monarchy. It's now known as a Tibetan Buddhist center and serves as a hub for hikers planning treks through the Himalayan mountain ranges of Sikkim. The city offers various tour packages to explore its surroundings, including Darjeeling, Kalimpong, Pelling, and more.
name: Gangtok
address: Sikkim, India

excerpt: Natural waterfall rushing down rocks into a small pool, viewable by a modest footbridge.
detail_description: Bakthang Waterfall is a hidden gem in East Sikkim, offering a serene and less touristy experience compared to other attractions. Located just an hour's drive from Gangtok, this natural wonder originates from the river Ratey Chu and cascades down against the backdrop of the Eastern Himalayas. The roaring sound of the waterfall can be heard from a distance, adding to its allure. Surrounded by dense vegetation, it provides an ideal setting for a peaceful picnic.
name: Bakthang Waterfall
address: 9J5F+4CF, Gangtok, Sikkim 737103, India

excerpt: Cable car linking Deorali Bazaar with Tashiling Secretariat, offering views of mountains & the city.
detail_description: The Gangtok Ropeway is a must-try experience for anyone visiting this vibrant city. This cable car ride connects Deorali Bazaar to Tashiling Secretariat, offering passengers stunning views of the surrounding mountains and the picturesque cityscape below. As you ascend, you'll be treated to breathtaking panoramas that include lush green valleys and the majestic Kanchenjunga range. The journey may not be lengthy, but it’s filled with excitement for both children and adults alike.
name: Gangtok Ropeway
address: Vishal Gaon, Gangtok, Sikkim 737102, India

detail_description: Nestled in the serene landscapes of Bulbuley, just 3 km from Gangtok, the Sikkim Himalayan Zoological Park is a must-visit for anyone who cherishes nature and wildlife. Spanning an impressive 205 hectares at an altitude of 1,780 meters, this park offers not only a sanctuary for exotic birds and animals but also breathtaking views of Mt. Khangchendzonga.
name: Sikkim Himalayan Zoological Park: Entry
address: 8JRC+MFC, Jawaharlal Nehru Rd, Sungava, Gangtok, Sikkim 737103, India

detail_description: Experience the breathtaking views of Gangtok by taking a ride on the Ropeway, also known as a cable car. With three terminal stations to choose from, this aerial journey offers mesmerizing vistas of the town and its surrounding valleys. The well-maintained cable cars ensure safety and comfort for up to 20 passengers at a time. Offering an opportunity to capture stunning photographs, this attraction provides an unforgettable experience within the city.
name: Ropeway
address: Syari Rd, Deorali Bazar, Gangtok, Sikkim 737102, India

excerpt: Colourful Buddhist monastery featuring golden statues & panoramic mountain views.
detail_description: Gonjang Monastery, located near Gangtok, is a vibrant Buddhist monastery with golden statues and breathtaking mountain vistas. Founded in 1981, this hidden gem offers a serene setting in the Himalayas. It provides an opportunity to explore Tibetan Buddhism through its stunning statues and murals. The monastery's silent and beautiful surroundings make it an ideal place to experience tranquility amidst the surreal mountains and green valleys. Additionally, visitors can enjoy a panoramic view from the monastery's spacious terrace.
name: Gonjang Monastery
address: 9JC8+6CQ, N Sikkim Hwy, Gangtok, Sikkim 737103, India

detail_description: Tsuglakhang Monastery & Temple, also known as Tsuklakhang Palace or Tsuklakhang Royal Chapel and Monastery, is a magnificent Buddhist palatial monastery located in Gangtok, Sikkim, India. This royal chapel has been the center for prayers and ceremonies for the Chogyals, featuring an assembly hall and a vast collection of Buddhist scriptures and literature.
name: Tsuglakhang Monastery & Temple
address: 8JG7+CVX, Secretariat Rd, Vishal Gaon, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: The Thakurbari Temple in Gangtok, Sikkim is a significant pilgrimage site and one of the oldest Hindu temples in the state. It was built on land donated by the Chogyal of Sikkim in 1935 and houses idols of major deities. The temple's serene atmosphere and beautiful architecture make it a must-visit spot for travelers exploring Gangtok.
name: Shri Thakurbari Temple, Gangtok
address: 8JJ7+27W, Mahatma Gandhi Marg, Arithang, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

excerpt: Multi-cuisine restaurant & pub with a lively atmosphere & live musical performances.
detail_description: Cafe Live & Loud is a vibrant multi-cuisine restaurant and pub in Gangtok, offering a lively atmosphere and live musical performances. Located just a short walk from MG Marg, it's known for its delectable dishes and enchanting live music, making it a captivating destination for a memorable dining experience. The cafe hosts regular live performances by local bands and musicians, creating an exciting vibe that appeals to the younger crowd.
name: Cafe Live & Loud
address: Tibet Rd, Arithang, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: Pub 25 is a popular nightclub in Gangtok, located in the New Market area on MG Marg. The club offers a British-style theme with chic interiors and a variety of elegant beverages. It's known for its quality food and drinks, making it a great place to hang out with friends or even enjoy solo. The upscale pub provides an amazing ambience and occasionally features live music, offering visitors a memorable experience.
name: Pub 25
address: 8JG6+PV7, Vishal Gaon, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: Sikkim Gangtok Tourism, also known as Dosregem Tours and Travels, offers a popular 7 Days Sikkim Tour Package at a discounted price of 24%. This package allows tourists to explore the major attractions in Gangtok, a place abundant with natural wonders. The highlight of this region is the majestic Kanchenjunga mountain, towering over other magnificent peaks in the Sikkim Himalayas.
name: Sikkim Gangtok Tourism, Dosregem Tours and Travels.
address: Bojoghari, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: Sikkim Paragliding in Gangtok is an exhilarating experience that offers breathtaking views of the Himalayas and the city. You don't need to be an expert as professional trainers ensure complete safety. Visitors can enjoy a bird's eye view of Gangtok and even head towards Luing Resithang near Khel Gaon. This popular activity attracts travelers from all over, providing an adrenaline rush and a chance to fulfill the dream of flying.
name: Sikkim Paragliding
address: 8HXW+77W, Ranka Road, Gangtok Reshithang, Ranka Rd, East, Sungava, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

excerpt: Building erected in memory of Claude White in 1932, with an Officers' Club & badminton court.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Gangtok, Sikkim, the White Memorial Hall stands as a tribute to Sir Claude White, the region's first political officer. Erected in 1932, this two-story structure is an exquisite example of colonial architecture that transports visitors back to a bygone era. The hall not only serves as a historical landmark but also functions as a vibrant cultural center where local art and crafts are celebrated through various events and exhibitions.
name: White Memorial Hall
address: 8JJ8+WG5, Ridge Rd, Tathangchen Area, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: Tsuklakhang, also known as Chogyal Palace, is a significant landmark in Gangtok with historical importance. While it's no longer accessible to the public, its grandeur can still be admired from Ganesh Tok. This palace holds a crucial role in Sikkim's history as it played a part in the state's merger with India in 1975. Its rich historical significance makes it an intriguing site for visitors interested in the region's past.
name: Tsuklakhang / Chogyal Palace
address: 8JG7+CRX, Secretariat Rd, Near Secretariat, Vishal Gaon, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: The Directorate of Handicrafts & Handloom, established in 1957, is a popular tourist attraction located just one kilometer away from the main market. The institute aims to preserve local art and handicrafts by providing training and employment opportunities to artisans. Visitors can observe workers creating carpets, fabric, and wood sculptures while exploring the emporium that promotes these crafts. Additionally, there is a museum showcasing various artifacts available for viewing with an entry ticket.
name: Directorate of Handicrafts & Handloom
address: 8JQ7+9V4, Zero Point, NH 31, A, Sungava, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: The Plant Conservatory, located near Gangtok in Sikkim, is a haven for nature enthusiasts and botany lovers. Situated amidst semi-wilderness along the road connecting Gangtok to Hanuman Tok, this botanical hub boasts over 400 species of plants and trees. Visitors can explore exotic gardens naturally growing on the hillside, with a picturesque waterfall cascading from the mountains and a small pond surrounded by giant rocks perfect for capturing memories.
name: Plant Conservatory
address: 9J6G+2W8, Gangtok, Sikkim 737103, India

detail_description: The Q Club is a professional sports club based in the Qatari capital Doha, which specializes in Snooker. The club was founded in 1975, and has since become one of the most successful sporting organisations on the planet. The team has won a total of 48 World Snooker Championship titles (the most prestigious title in the sport), as well as other major awards including 6 British Open Championships, 5 Masters Championships, 2 European Open Championships and 3 Crucible Masters.
name: The Q Club(SNOOKER)
address: Snooker, The Q Club, Deorali School St, Deorali Bazar, Gangtok, Sikkim 737102, India

name: Lhasa Waterfall
address: 9J8G+FHV, Gangtok, Sikkim 737103, India

detail_description: Baba Mandir, located at a high altitude of 4000 meters, offers stunning views of snow-covered landscapes. The lack of oxygen in the air due to its elevation should be taken into consideration when visiting. Visitors need a permit to access this holy site, which is maintained by the Indian Army. It's important to be cautious with local drivers who may try to deceive tourists about taking them there.
name: Baba Mandir Bojoghari East Sikkim
address: Lower Bojoghari, Bypass Road, Gangtok, Sikkim 737103, India

detail_description: This was my inaugural journey with Thrillophilia and a group of strangers. I must admit that Thrillophilia lived up to its reputation (no one is flawless, so it's important to be adaptable when facing minor hiccups). The entire trip proceeded seamlessly, commencing with the airport pickup, accommodations received, permits arranged, sightseeing expeditions, and finally drop-off at the airport.
name: North Sikkim Tour
address: Burtuk Rd, Burtuk, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: Namgyal Treks & Tours is a reputable tour operator located about one kilometer away from Gangtok's main market. The institute building, surrounded by lush trees, showcases Tibetan architectural style and is a significant sightseeing spot for religious tourists. Visitors have praised the company for its professionalism, transparency, and warm hospitality. They are known for their meticulous planning and personalized approach to trip arrangements.
name: Namgyal Treks & Tours
address: Tibet Rd, Arithang, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

excerpt: Founded in 1961, this Ngorpa Tibetan Buddhist monastery features sweeping views.
detail_description: Sa Ngor Chotshog Center, founded in 1961, is a culturally significant Tibetan Buddhist monastery located in the Upper Tathangchen area of Gangtok. It belongs to the Sakya Order of Tibetan Buddhism, making it unique in Sikkim. The monastery offers sweeping views and features ancient paintings and thangkas to be enjoyed inside.
name: Sa Ngor Chotshog Center
address: 8JRV+HGP, Upper Tathangchen, Gangtok, Sikkim 737103, India

detail_description: White Hall, located in Gangtok, is a significant historical site renowned for its distinctive British architectural style. Erected in honor of Sikkim's inaugural political officer, the memorial serves as a poignant reminder of bygone times. The building is set amidst picturesque gardens, providing visitors with a tranquil and serene atmosphere to explore and reflect upon its rich heritage.
name: White Hall
address: Ridge Rd, Arithang, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: Sikkim Tour Packages offered by Chirag Travels provide excellent management and food services, making it a peaceful and nature-friendly destination worth visiting. The region offers a wonderful experience with its beautiful natural surroundings, perfect for enjoying with friends and family. Additionally, Sikkim boasts famous international brands for clothing and fashion, adding to the overall appeal of the place.
name: Sikkim Tour Packages
address: Deorali Gangtok, East Sikkim, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

name: Guide Sikkim Tour & Travels
address: Sisa Golai Sisa Golai, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: "Udaan Silk Route Tours & Travels" offers well-organized tours to Nathula Pass, also known as the Silk Route. The pass is located 57 km away from Gangtok and boasts stunning snow-covered scenery. The agency provides proper guidance, well-maintained cars, punctual service, and friendly drivers. Clients have praised the comfortable and luxurious tour packages offered at reasonable prices.
name: Udaan Silk Route Tours & Travels
address: Mahatma Gandhi Marg, above Axis bank, opposite Bata, Arithang, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: Travelers Paradise is a homestay that offers a delightful 2-day, 1-night stay experience. Situated on the edge of a hilltop, it provides breathtaking views of the Himalayan foothills, snowy Nathula peaks, and the meandering Teesta River. The service is exceptional and professional, making it an ideal choice for those seeking a peaceful retreat with stunning natural surroundings.
name: Travelers paradise
address: NH10, opposite gurudwara sahib, Upper Tadong, Tadong, Gangtok, Sikkim 737102, India

detail_description: The Seven Sisters Waterfall is a renowned natural attraction situated on the Gangtok-Lachung Highway, approximately 32 kilometers from Gangtok. The name "Seven Sisters" comes from the seven distinct streams that flow harmoniously down a wide cliff. This waterfall is particularly captivating after periods of rain or snowmelt, when the water cascades fiercely and creates a breathtaking sight and roaring sound as it hits the limestone below.
name: The Seven Sisters Waterfall
address: Sikkim 737118, India

detail_description: Paljor Stadium, also known as Palzor Stadium, is a popular association football stadium situated in Gangtok, Sikkim, India. It serves as the home ground for the United Sikkim Football Club and is a significant tourist attraction in the city.
name: Paljor Stadium
address: Palzor Stadium Rd, Upper Sichey, Arithang, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

excerpt: Multiple varieties of rhododendrons bloom from April to July in this mountain nature reserve.
detail_description: Shingba Rhododendron Sanctuary, nestled in the mountainous terrain of North Sikkim, India, is a haven for nature enthusiasts. With over forty species of rhododendron trees, the sanctuary bursts into a vibrant display of colors from April to July. Located en route to Yumthang Valley, it offers a serene and tranquil ambiance for visitors to immerse themselves in the beauty of nature.
name: Shingba Rhododendron Sanctuary
address: RQ29+GR6, Sikkim 737120, India

detail_description: The Black Cat Museum in Gangtok is a fascinating attraction that pays tribute to the Indian Army's elite commando unit, the Black Cats. Visitors can explore captivating displays showcasing the unit's missions and achievements, offering insight into their bravery and skills. The museum features detailed exhibits on Sikkim's history and the Black Cat Division, including a collection of old photographs and historical weapons.
name: Black Cat Museum
address: 8J92+2WQ, Lingding Rd, Upper Tadong, Deorali Bazar, Gangtok, Sikkim 737102, India

excerpt: Landscaped gardens & a greenhouse showcasing a variety of flora & fauna, popular with picnickers.
detail_description: Saramsa Garden, located in a serene area of Sikkim, is a beautifully landscaped garden and greenhouse that showcases a diverse range of flora and fauna. It is a popular spot for picnics and offers ample space for both kids and adults to enjoy amidst nature. While the entry fee is reasonable, some visitors have noted that the maintenance by staff could be improved. Nevertheless, it's an ideal place for recreational activities, gatherings with family or friends, and small events.
name: Saramsa Garden
address: 7HGV+RWX, Sikkim 737102, India

excerpt: Landscaped garden featuring a variety of flowers, plus fountains & other water features.
detail_description: Jawaharlal Nehru Botanical Garden, located near the famous Rumtek Monastery in East Sikkim, is a stunning landscaped garden showcasing a diverse range of flowers and water features. Renowned for its orchids, the garden also houses rare botanical treasures such as temperate oak forests. Visitors can explore the beauty of various trees and capture picturesque moments while strolling through this enchanting garden.
name: Jawaharlal Nehru Botanical Garden
address: 7HV7+WG6, Sang Rd, Rumtek, Gangtok, Sikkim 737135, India

excerpt: A UNESCO World Heritage site, this reserve features scenic hiking & the world's third-highest peak.
detail_description: Kanchenjunga National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage site located in West Sikkim, is a haven for nature enthusiasts. The park boasts diverse flora and fauna, glacial lakes, and ancient forests surrounding the world's third-highest peak, Mount Kanchenjunga. Visitors can explore the park's scenic hiking trails and immerse themselves in the rich biodiversity of the region.
name: Kanchenjunga National Park
address: Sikkim, India

detail_description: Shanti Viewpoint offers a picturesque view of Gangtok city and the snow-capped mountain tops of North Sikkim. On clear, sunny days, the view can be breathtaking. Visitors can enjoy hot refreshments and tea/coffee at nearby stalls. The viewpoint is a good place to take a short break before continuing to Rumtek Monastery, which is just a few kilometers away. Additionally, there are two cafes offering quality tea and snacks.
name: Shanti Viewpoint
address: 7HXF+5P5, Ranipool-Rumtek-Sang Rd, Sikkim 737135, India

detail_description: Fambong Lho Wildlife Sanctuary, located about 20 km from Gangtok in the East Sikkim district of India, is a haven for nature enthusiasts. The sanctuary boasts diverse flora and fauna, including rare species like the red panda, Himalayan bear, rhododendrons, barking deer, and yellow-throated marten. Visitors can enjoy a peaceful trek through the wild forest with the chance to spot wildlife depending on the season.
name: Fambonglho Wildlife Sanctuary
address: Dikchu - Rang Rang, Road, L. Mangshila, Sikkim 737107, India

detail_description: Kabi Lungchok, situated in the North District of Sikkim, around 19-20 kilometers away from Gangtok, is a significant historical site. This location witnessed the signing of a friendship treaty between the Lepcha chief Tekung Tek and Bhutia Chief Khey Bum Sar. The spot where this treaty was sealed is now marked by a stone pillar and also features a small Buddhist monastery.
name: Kabi Lungchok
address: 9JX5+FQ5, Kabi, Sikkim 737117, India

excerpt: This 31-sq.-km. wildlife sanctuary features animals & endangered plants, including orchids.
detail_description: Nestled in the Tsomgo Lake area, Kyongnosla Alpine Sanctuary is a captivating high-altitude wildlife sanctuary in India. Encompassing 31 square kilometers, it boasts a diverse range of flora and fauna, including rare orchids, rhododendrons, primulas, and medicinal plants. The sanctuary is renowned for its population of Red Pandas and Snow Leopards.
name: Kyongnosla Alpine Sanctuary
address: 9PGM+MJJ, JN Rd, Dichenling Area, Gangtok, Sikkim 737103, India

excerpt: Rustic-chic quarters in an upmarket casino resort with dining, bars & a spa, plus free breakfast.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Gangtok, MAYFAIR Spa Resort & Casino offers a luxurious and rejuvenating experience inspired by Buddhist monastic architecture. The resort features a blend of Sikkim's cultural heritage and modern amenities, providing guests with rustic-chic accommodations. Whether you're looking to try your luck at the casino or indulge in a relaxing spa treatment, this resort has it all.
name: MAYFAIR Spa Resort & Casino, Gangtok
address: Lower Samdur Block, Ranipool, Gangtok, Sikkim 737135, India

name: Phensang Monastery
address: CJC6+73J, Sikkim 737116, India
